genius.core.utility

Class AdditiveUtilitySpace

  • java.lang.Object
    • genius.core.utility.AbstractUtilitySpace
      • genius.core.utility.AdditiveUtilitySpace
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UtilitySpace, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdditiveUtilitySpaceWithPerturbation, OpponentModelUtilSpace, UncertainAdditiveUtilitySpace, UtilitySpaceAdapter

    public class AdditiveUtilitySpace
extends AbstractUtilitySpace
    The additive utility space couples all objectives to weights and evaluators.
    Author:
    D. Tykhonov, K. Hindriks, W. Pasman
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • AdditiveUtilitySpace

        public AdditiveUtilitySpace(Domain domain,
                            java.lang.String fileName)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Create new default util space for a given domain.
        Parameters:
        domain -
        fileName - to read domain from. Set fileName to "" if no file available, in which case default evaluators are loaded..
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error occurs, e.g. if domain does not match the util space, or file not found.

      • AdditiveUtilitySpace

        public AdditiveUtilitySpace(AdditiveUtilitySpace us)
        Copies the data from another UtilitySpace.
        Parameters:
        us - utility space to be cloned.

    • Method Detail

      • getUtility

        public double getUtility(Bid bid)
        implements UtilitySpace
        Parameters:
        bid - of which we are interested in its utility.
        Returns:
        Utility of the given bid. This utility is undiscounted: there is no time dependent devaluation of the utility. See also UtilitySpace.discount(double, double).

                    throws java.io.IOException

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getEvaluator

        public Evaluator getEvaluator(Objective obj)
        Parameters:
        obj - the objective for which an evaluator is needed
        Returns:
        evaluator for given objective, or null if no such objective.

      • getEvaluation

        public final double getEvaluation(int pIssueIndex,
                                  Bid bid)
        Returns the utility of one issue in the bid. Note that this value is in the range [0,1] as it is not normalized by the issue weight. Only works with linear utility spaces.
        Parameters:
        pIssueIndex - of the issue.
        bid -
        Returns:
        evaluation of the value of the issue of the given bid.

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight(int issueID)
        Parameters:
        issueID - The Issue or Objective to get the weight from
        Returns:
        The weight, or 0 if the objective doesn't exist. Only works with linear utility spaces.

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight(Objective obj)

      • setWeight

        public double setWeight(Objective objective,
                        double weight)
        Method used to set the weight of the given objective. Only works if the objective has been unlockeed.
        Parameters:
        objective - of which the weights must be set.
        weight - to which the weight of the objective must be set.
        Returns:
        the new weight of the issue after normalization.

      • addEvaluator

        public final Evaluator addEvaluator(Objective obj,
                                    Evaluator ev)
        Sets an [Objective, evaluator] pair. Replaces old evaluator for objective.
        Parameters:
        obj - The Objective to attach an Evaluator to.
        ev - The Evaluator to attach.
        Returns:
        The given evaluator.

      • getEvaluators

        public final java.util.Set<java.util.Map.Entry<Objective,Evaluator>> getEvaluators()
        Returns:
        The set with all pairs of evaluators and objectives in this utility space.

      • lock

        public final boolean lock(Objective obj)
        Place a lock on the weight of an objective or issue. Mainly used to guide the normalization procedure.
        Parameters:
        obj - The objective or issue that is about to have it's weight locked.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false If the objective doesn't have an evaluator yet.

      • unlock

        public final boolean unlock(Objective obj)
        Clear a lock on the weight of an objective or issue. Mainly used to guide the normalization procedure.
        Parameters:
        obj - The objective or issue that is having it's lock cleared.
        Returns:
        true If the lock is cleared, false if the objective or issue doesn't have an evaluator yet.

      • normalizeChildren

        public final java.util.Set<java.util.Map.Entry<Objective,Evaluator>> normalizeChildren(Objective obj)
        Normalizes the weights of non-locked objectives of the given objective so that all objective weights they sum up to one.
        Parameters:
        obj - of which the weights must be normalized.
        Returns:
        all evaluators using getEvaluators().
